page.title: 01LANDSCAPE & HOUSING
page.content:
{ LANDSCAPE & HOUSING}
This is part of an area of outstanding natural beauty unspoilt by commercial activities. Agriculture and Tourism are the major activities of this area. The major land use is for grazing and crops for the dairy industry and very little grown for human consumption. Housing is concentrated in one village which houses 1000 people the majority of whom live on 3 Council estates. There is scattered housing on the 16 farms and hamlets in the area. Much of the housing is used during the Summer months to accommodate tourists in bed and breakfast. There are 3 centres for self-catering accommodation but no caravan or tent parks.
